intro: Karvandarina cartilaginea, commonly known as the cartilage plant, is a unique species belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its fleshy, translucent leaves that resemble cartilage, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is native to certain regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky soils and dry climates. Due to its striking appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
